Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek pottery closed vase, probably oinochoe. Clay brown with reddish tinge, dull cream slip on outside. Part of an animal frieze: head of goat to right with filling ornament of rosettes and cross with small circles; black band above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Almost certainly joins Boston, MFA 88.948, as suggested by Hayes (1992, 204, N4): "possibly joins right side the Boston fragment, Fairbanks, Boston Cat. No. 321.12 pl. 34 (not checked). Probably North Ionian, a number of other Naukratis finds appear to be in the same style. For a possible forerunner, see the well-preserved oinochoe from Old Smyrna in Akurgal, Eski Izmir 43-44 (= German ed. p. 48) pls. 38-39 and colour pl. B-C."
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 204 no. N4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.417)
